Package UserInterface

Class UITable

java.lang.Object
UserInterface.Frame
UserInterface.DocumentCell
UserInterface.UITable
public class UITable
extends DocumentCell
A class to represent tables in the UI layer.

  • Constructor Details

    • UITable

      public UITable​(int x, int y, int width, int height, java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<DocumentCell>> rows) throws java.lang.Exception
      Create a UITable based on the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - : The x coordinate of this UITable.
      y - : The y coordinate of this UITable.
      width - : The width of this UITable.
      height - : The height of this UITable.
      rows - : The number of rows of this UITable.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

  • Method Details

    • Render

      public void Render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Render every cell in the grid.
      Overrides:
      Render in class DocumentCell
      Parameters:
      g - : The graphics to be updated.

    • getHandleMouse

      public java.lang.String getHandleMouse​(int id, int x, int y, int clickCount, int button, int modifier)
      Handle mouse events by forwarding the click to each cell. If a cell returns something (=href) this method returns this. Else, it returns the empty string (= "")
      Overrides:
      getHandleMouse in class DocumentCell
      Parameters:
      id - : The type of mouse action
      x - : The x coordinate of the mouse action.
      y - : The y coordinate of the mouse action.
      clickCount - : The number of times the mouse has clicked.
      button - : The mouse button that was clicked.
      modifier - : Possible other keys that were pressed during this mouse action.
      Returns:
      "": the empty string.

    • handleResize

      public void handleResize​(int newWindowWidth, int newWindowHeight)
      Re-calculates the necessary widths and heights of the DocumentCells
      Overrides:
      handleResize in class DocumentCell
      Parameters:
      newWindowWidth - : The width the DocumentCell will be resized to.
      newWindowHeight - : The height the DocumentCell will be resized to.

    • getMaxHeight

      public int getMaxHeight()
      Returns the maximum height of the table. Only returns a useful answer after calling setRowHeights() to set the used ArrayList
      Overrides:
      getMaxHeight in class DocumentCell
      Returns:
      1: this is always equal to 1.

    • getMaxWidth

      public int getMaxWidth()
      Returns the maximum width of the table. Only returns a useful answer after colling setColumnWidths() to set the used ArrayList
      Overrides:
      getMaxWidth in class DocumentCell
      Returns:
      1: this is always equal to 1.

    • setRowHeights

      public void setRowHeights()
      This methods calculates the needed height of each row. It also sets the desired height and y-position of the cells in UITable.

    • setColumnWidths

      public void setColumnWidths()
      This methods calculates the needed width of each column. It also sets the desired width and x-position of the cells in this UITable.

    • setxPos

      public void setxPos​(int xPos)
      Set the x position of this Table to the given value
      Overrides:
      setxPos in class Frame
      Parameters:
      xPos - : The new x position this Table will be set to.

    • setyPos

      public void setyPos​(int yPos)
      Set the y position of this Table to the given value
      Overrides:
      setyPos in class Frame
      Parameters:
      yPos - : The new y position this Table will be set to.

    • getContent

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<DocumentCell>> getContent()
      simple getter, only for debug purposes
      Returns:
      grid: The grid that holds the DocumentCell's of this UITable.
